meanings.sent1: The small, implantable device helped monitor his heart rate.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended an implantable chip to track his movements.
meanings.sent3: The implantable sensor was so tiny, it felt like a secret agent on a mission.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an implantable memory, etched in his mind forever.
meanings.sent5: The implantable idea took root in his imagination, growing stronger each day.

meanings.definition: Able to be inserted or placed within the body.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon discussed the benefits of an implantable pacemaker.
meanings.sent2: The new technology allowed for safer implantable medical devices.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the implantable gadget turned her into a cyborg.
meanings.sent4: His words were like implantable thoughts, embedding themselves in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The implantable solution provided a seamless integration into his daily routine.
